function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Use of wastewater samples for early detection of COVID-19 may lead to false positives or false negatives due to different assay sensitivities.","Impact":"Inaccurate detection may result in delayed response to outbreaks or unnecessary panic in communities.","Mitigation":"Standardize the use of specific assays and validate their performance in detecting SARS-CoV-2 in wastewater samples.","Technologies":"Standardized RT-PCR/qPCR assay protocols, validation kits for wastewater sample testing.","People":"Communities relying on early detection from wastewater samples, public health officials, researchers.","Owner":"Public health agencies, research institutions, assay developers."},{"Description":"Differences in assay sensitivity and LOD (Limit of Detection) may lead to inconsistent results in detecting SARS-CoV-2 RNA in wastewater samples.","Impact":"Inconsistent results may lead to uncertainty in assessing the sensitivity.","Technologies":"Consensus guidelines for LOD thresholds, advanced RT-PCR/qPCR technologies for wastewater sample testing.","People":"Researchers, public health officials, policy makers.","Owner":"Regulatory bodies, research institutions, public health agencies."},{"Description":"Use of multiple assays with varying sensitivity for detecting SARS-CoV-2 in wastewater samples may multiple assay results.","People":"Public health officials, researchers, wastewater treatment authorities.","Owner":"Public health agencies, research institutions, wastewater treatment
